channel.title: Shut down pc when inactive?
channel.description: is there a way my computer can automatically shut down afters its idle for 15, 20 minutes? i mainly want to know this because i want to leave a auto working before going to school and as the script only works for approx.3 hours the computer is left on for ages and wastes electricity and internet. so yea just want my comp to shut down its self if its inactive. anyone know how?

item.title: Shut down pc when inactive?
item.dc:creator: @sidishere sidishere
item.description:
@sidishere wrote:

lol guys dont worry i got the program already so when my computer is idle and its idle when the script stops running

Read full topic

item.title: Shut down pc when inactive?
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

Yes, which then makes the computer idle, and whatever you set the hibernation time to, that’s how long after the script shuts off that the computer will then go into hibernation.

Read full topic

item.title: Shut down pc when inactive?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

It’s not after “so long.” It’s after his script executes or gets stuck.

Read full topic

item.title: Shut down pc when inactive?
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

How is that not what he was asking? His thread asks if there is a way to shut down the computer after so long. Making it go into hibernation after a certain period of time basically does that.

Read full topic

item.title: Shut down pc when inactive?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“Sick of Air, post:18, topic:157695”]Start > Control Panel > Power Options

From there, set the Hibernation. Hibernation basically shuts off your computer. A move of the mouse or press of a button turns it back on. The computer is only operational to do that, so it’s using very little power and electricity. Or do what I do and don’t worry about that stuff. I have two computers running 24/7. The only time I turn them off is during thunderstorms.[/quote]

That’s not what he was asking.

Read full topic

item.title: Shut down pc when inactive?
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

Start > Control Panel > Power Options

From there, set the Hibernation. Hibernation basically shuts off your computer. A move of the mouse or press of a button turns it back on. The computer is only operational to do that, so it’s using very little power and electricity. Or do what I do and don’t worry about that stuff. I have two computers running 24/7. The only time I turn them off is during thunderstorms.

Read full topic

call shutdown.exe ?

item.title: Shut down pc when inactive?
item.dc:creator: @sidishere sidishere
item.description:
@sidishere wrote:

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:15, topic:157695”]You could just get scar to check up on mouse movements…
If the mouse is inactive for 5-10 minutes it press’s window button, then “u”, then “u”…

All done.[/quote]
could you give me a script for that?[br][size=1]Posted on: November 09, 2007, 06:36:59 PM[/size][hr]dont worry i already got a program for it…

Read full topic

item.title: Shut down pc when inactive?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

You could just get scar to check up on mouse movements…
If the mouse is inactive for 5-10 minutes it press’s window button, then “u”, then “u”…

All done.

item.title: Shut down pc when inactive?
item.dc:creator: @_cake _cake
item.description:
@_cake wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:13, topic:157695”][quote author=_cake link=topic=215004.msg1876310#msg1876310 date=1194578103]
I believe there’s some type of ‘event manager’ in windows for this, mainly used to make pop ups to say ‘upgrade this’ ever 5 minutes or so.
[/quote]

Except the event manager can’t tell when scar is finished running. Correct me if I’m wrong.[/quote]
Correct, thank you for correcting me.

Read full topic

item.title: Shut down pc when inactive?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

First, copy paste the shutdown procedure into the script, probably right before the main loop.

Second, wherever it says TerminateScript (or something similar) and right before the final ‘end.’ put a call to the shutdown procedure.

Read full topic

item.title: Shut down pc when inactive?
item.dc:creator: @OWNER_2007 OWNER 2007
item.description:

Not shut down but log off i know of. Go to properties, screen saver, then click the option of “log off after:”. Then enter the time and done.
